title: CNN: Scientists in the US are flying planes into clouds to make it snow more
creator: Jennifer Gray and Rachel Ramirez, CNN
description:
If you use long text you should use <br> tag in your description
With 61% of the contiguous US in drought, wouldn’t it be nice if we could just “make it rain” or just “make more snow?”
Well, certain parts of the country are doing just that, sort of. It’s called cloud seeding, and it’s nothing new.
It’s been around since the 1940s and countries all over the world have been doing it for various reasons (most notably China), but it’s a growing practice in the US, especially in the drought-stricken West.
subject: weather modification
source: Gray, J., & Ramirez, R. (2022, March 14). Scientists in the US are flying planes into clouds to make it snow more. CNN. https://www.cnn.com/2022/03/14/weather/cloud-seeding-weather-modification-wxn/index.html

title: The War against Trucks Aerial Interdiction in Southern Laos 1968-1972
creator: Bernard C. Nalty
description: An overview of the US Air Force's six years of weather modification activities using photoflash cartriges, stating the results were not convincing.
subject: military weather modification
source: Nalty, B. (2005). The War Against Trucks Aerial Interdication in Southern Laos 1968-1972. Air Force History and Museums Program.

title: Cover Page: The War against Trucks Aerial Interdiction in Southern Laos 1968-1972
creator: Bernard C. Nalty
description: Detailed report on the use of weather modification to increase the rain in Southeast Asia, thereby creating impassable muddy roads on or near the Ho Chi Minh Trail.
subject: military weather modification
source: Nalty, B. (2005). The War Against Trucks Aerial Interdication in Southern Laos 1968-1972. Air Force History and Museums Program.

title: Cover Page: US 93 Congress Hearing, 2nd Session, of the Committee on Foreign Relations
creator: Subcommittee on Oceans and International Environment
description: Pros and Cons of Weather Modification with emphasis on International Repercussions

title: Weather modification used for military purposes in Southeast Asia

title: Civil applications of weather modifications can be benefitial as it was to the military

title: Potential environmental and geophysical weapons
creator: Subcommittee on Oceans and International Environment
description: Potential environmental and geophysical weapons
subject: congress weather modification

creator: Subcommittee on Oceans and International Environment
description: It was concluded that weather modification can be used as a tactical weapon. Two aircraft types were used, WC-130 and RF-4C , both had 104 sondes per pod. They were dropped in the Laotian panhandle and would be effective for 30 minutes to 6 hours, weather depending.
subject: congress weather modification

creator: Subcommittee on Oceans and International Environment
description: The Southeast Asian missions were the only classified weather modification missions conducted.
subject: congress weather modification

creator: Subcommittee on Oceans and International Environment
description: It appears there were two other foreign weather modification mission approved for future operations, one in Panama, and the other in the Azores. Previously there were two missions conducted in the Phillipines and in Okinawa.Were they classified or unclassified?
subject: congress weather modification

title: Annual Report to: The President and The Congress by the National Advisory Committee on Oceans and Atmosphere - Cover Page
creator: Nierenberg & Hargis
description: Annual Report on activities of the United States on Ocean and Atmospheric Matters, including Weather Modification
subject: 1970s weather modification; Annual Report
source: Nierenberg, W., & Hargis, W. (1972). 1st Annual Report. National Advisory on Oceans and Atmosphere.

title: Annual Report to: The President and The Congress by the National Advisory Committee on Oceans and Atmosphere - Page
creator: Nierenberg & Hargis
description: In Cold War parlance, a comparison to Soviet Union successes in weather modification to supress hail. This document highlights that weather modification does have great potential for benefits to society, but also has equally risky social implications.
subject: 1970s weather modification; Annual Report

title: Annual Report to: The President and The Congress by the National Advisory Committee on Oceans and Atmosphere - Page
creator: Nierenberg & Hargis
description: A recommendation for the Federal Government to begin regulating weather modification, both within the government and in commercial operations

creator: Nierenberg & Hargis
description: Discussion of moving the US civilian research project StormFury to the Pacific versus the Atlantic, and to begin an effort to garner international support via an conference to be held in 1974.

title: Annual Report to: The President and The Congress by the National Advisory Committee on Oceans and Atmosphere - Page
creator: Nierenberg & Hargis

title: Annual Report to: The President and The Congress by the National Advisory Committee on Oceans and Atmosphere - Page

description: A document stating there are scientific exchanges with the Soviet Union and other countries on weather modification, but also highlights there are grave impacts that must be looked into.
